text: AWS amplifi brings a full stack
typescript developer experience to AWS
built with front-end developers in mind
first I'll globally deploy a serers side
rendered nextjs app using amplify
hosting with zero config I can use all
of my favorite Frameworks like n and V
every time I push my code it'll redeploy
globally
automatically I deployed my front end
app but now let's add backend
functionality with amplify all modify
the code in the data resource. TS file
full stack typescript capabilities
automatically provision Cloud resources
for use cases like data off file storage
and server lless functions I'll write
just a few lines of code to create a
data model since the experience is fully
in typescript you can see the developer
experience has intellisense suggestions
for all the code that I'm
writing in the O resource. TS file I'll
also add a custom email subject to my
Authentication
I can use the amplify libraries to
connect my front end to my back end
using Frameworks and languages like
react react native Swift flutter and
Android I can do similar for O then use
the authenticator component to add a
fully customizable off flow for my users
quickly and
easily amplify has a built-in workflow
for teams to operate efficiently
together every developer on a team gets
their own Cloud sandbox once a feature
is ready to ship all that they need to
do is merge in their GI Branch your
source code is your source of Truth
amplify is built with the AWS cdk
empowered by services like Amazon Dynamo
DB Amazon S3 and ews Lambda you can be
confident that you won't outgrow
building with amplify you can use the
AWS cdk to modify resources beyond the
ones natively supported by
amplify in this example we are
connecting to Amazon bedrock in order to
generate Hi C based off of images that
we
upload you can learn all about how to
build with AWS amplify at docs.
